metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Comments can be used to explain Java code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to prevent execution when testing alternative code.
content.html: Comments can be used to explain Java code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to prevent execution when testing alternative code.

content.text: Single-line comments start with two forward slashes ( // ).
content.html: Single-line comments start with two forward slashes (//).

content.text: Any text between // and the end of the line is ignored by Java (will not be executed).
content.html: Any text between // and the end of the line is ignored by Java (will not be executed).

content.text: This example uses a single-line comment before a line of code:
content.html: This example uses a single-line comment before a line of code:

content.code_html:
// This is a comment
System.out.println("Hello World");

content.text: This example uses a single-line comment at the end of a line of code:
content.html: This example uses a single-line comment at the end of a line of code:

content.code_html: System.out.println("Hello World"); // This is a comment

content.text: Multi-line comments start with /* and ends with */ .
content.html: Multi-line comments start with /* and ends with */.

content.text: Any text between /* and */ will be ignored by Java.
content.html: Any text between /* and */ will be ignored by Java.

content.text: This example uses a multi-line comment (a comment block) to explain the code:
content.html: This example uses a multi-line comment (a comment block) to explain the code:

content.code:
/* The code below will print the words Hello World
to the screen, and it is amazing */


System
.
out
.
println
(
"Hello World"
)
;
content.code_html:
/* The code below will print the words Hello World
to the screen, and it is amazing */
System.out.println("Hello World");

content.text: It's up to you which one you use. Normally, we use // for short comments, and /* */ for longer.
content.html: It's up to you which one you use. Normally, we use // for short comments, and /* */ for longer.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the meaning of comments in Java?
content.html: What is the meaning of comments in Java?

metadata.question: What is the meaning of comments in Java?

options.text: To print text and numbers with a simple line of code

content.question: What is the meaning of comments in Java?

options.text: To print text and numbers with a simple line of code
